meanings.definition: Inspiring fear or unease; strange and frightening.
meanings.sent1: The abandoned house on the hill had the eeriest atmosphere, making me shiver.
meanings.sent2: The forest at night can be the eeriest place with its mysterious sounds.
meanings.sent3: The eeriest part of the horror movie was when the ghost started dancing.
meanings.sent4: The eeriest feeling crept over me as I walked through the dark, empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The eeriest shadow loomed over the old graveyard, sending chills down my spine.

meanings.definition: Causing a feeling of fear or unease; strange and frightening.
meanings.sent1: The eerie sound of footsteps in the empty house was the eeriest thing I had ever heard.
meanings.sent2: The fog rolling in over the lake created the eeriest scene at dusk.
meanings.sent3: It was the eeriest coincidence that we both wore the same costume to the party.
meanings.sent4: The eeriest part of the story was when the protagonist realized they were being followed.
meanings.sent5: The eeriest painting in the museum seemed to follow you with its eyes as you walked by.
